Judul: A REVIEW OF EFFECTS, REGULATION AND ANALYTICAL DETERMINATION METHOD OF NONANTIBIOTIC ACTIVE INGREDIENTS IN FACIAL SKINCARE PRODUCTS TOWARDS ACNE-CAUSING  BACTERIA
Abstrak:
Acne vulgarisis a chronic dermatosis condition of skin’s pilosebaceous follicles. The growth of acnecausing bacteria (P. acnes, S. aureus and S. epidermidis) are reported as an example of acne vulgaris 
pathogenicity. The trend of formulating non-antibiotic active ingredients in facial skincare products 
are rapidly growing, including in Indonesia. Along with the trend, speculations of anti-acne activity 
exhibited by these active ingredients starts to emerged in conjunction to its antimicrobial potency. 
However, antimicrobial activity potency of these active ingredients is not yet proven especially 
against acne-causing bacteria. Objective: This literature review aimed to serve information 
regarding the use of non-antibiotic active ingredients in facial skincare products of acne vulgaris
treatment covering its antimicrobial activity against acne-causing bacteria, international regulation 
and standard analytical determination method. Methods: A systematic literature review involving 
92 literatures is performed. Results: Benzoyl peroxide, azelaic acid, salicylic acid, retinaldehyde, 
niacinamide, and probiotics and its derivatives shown a promising antimicrobial activity against 
acne-causing bacteria. According to regulation issued by BPOM RI, ACD and EC, regulation has only 
covers three out of six studied non-antibiotic active ingredients. Lastly, International standard 
analytical determination method of each non-antibiotic active ingredients is not yet issued except 
for one studied active ingredient. Conclusion: (1) Six non-antibiotic active ingredients proven to 
exerted a beneficial antimicrobial activity (2) Three studied non-antibiotic active ingredients has 
been regulated and no current regulation applied for the use of probiotics in cosmetic; (3) 
International standard analytical determination methods are not yet issued for studied active 
ingredients except salicylic acid.
